The theory of parton energy loss in quark-gluon plasma (QGP) and its associated jet quenching
phenomenology in heavy ion collisions has evolved significantly over the past decade, driven by
precise measurements from RHIC and LHC. Despite these advancements, fundamental questions
remain, such as how parton energy loss in QGP depends on the medium path-length ğ¿. In these
proceedings, we discuss how this question can be addressed through a data-driven strategy. More
specifically, we will exploit the scaling properties of large-ğ‘ âŠ¥ hadron spectra in heavy ion collisions,
predicted by a simple analytic energy loss model and observed in experimental data. In addition, we
show that jet measurements obey one such scaling law, offering the possibility to study jet energy
loss in QGP within the same strategy.
